description: Creates an orchestration of data collection rules. The Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise Edge Agent software running in vehicles uses campaigns to decide how to collect and transfer data to the cloud. You create campaigns in the cloud. After you or your team approve campaigns, Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise automatically deploys them to vehicles. For more information, see Collect and transfer data with campaigns in the Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise Developer Guide.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the campaign to create.

parameters.name: signalCatalogArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the signal catalog to associate with the campaign.

parameters.name: targetArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the vehicle or fleet to deploy a campaign to.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The time, in milliseconds, to deliver a campaign after it was approved. If it's not specified, 0 is used. Default: 0

parameters.name: expiryTime
parameters.description: The time the campaign expires, in seconds since epoch (January 1, 1970 at midnight UTC time). Vehicle data isn't collected after the campaign expires. Default: 253402214400 (December 31, 9999, 00:00:00 UTC)

parameters.name: postTriggerCollectionDuration
parameters.description: How long (in milliseconds) to collect raw data after a triggering event initiates the collection. If it's not specified, 0 is used. Default: 0

parameters.name: diagnosticsMode
parameters.description: Option for a vehicle to send diagnostic trouble codes to Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise. If you want to send diagnostic trouble codes, use SEND_ACTIVE_DTCS. If it's not specified, OFF is used. Default: OFF.

parameters.name: spoolingMode
parameters.description: Determines whether to store collected data after a vehicle lost a connection with the cloud. After a connection is re-established, the data is automatically forwarded to Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise. If you want to store collected data when a vehicle loses connection with the cloud, use TO_DISK. If it's not specified, OFF is used. Default: OFF.

parameters.name: compression
parameters.description: Determines whether to compress signals before transmitting data to Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise. If you don't want to compress the signals, use OFF. If it's not specified, SNAPPY is used. Default: SNAPPY.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: A number indicating the priority of one campaign over another campaign for a certain vehicle or fleet. A campaign with the lowest value is deployed to vehicles before any other campaigns. If it's not specified, 0 is used. Default: 0

parameters.name: signalsToCollect
parameters.description: A list of information about signals to collect. (dict) --- Information about a signal. The name of the signal. maxSampleCount (integer) --- The maximum number of samples to collect. minimumSamplingIntervalMs (integer) --- The minimum duration of time (in milliseconds) between two triggering events to collect data. dataPartitionId (string) --- The ID of the data partition this signal is associated with. The ID must match one of the IDs provided in dataPartitions. This is accomplished either by specifying a particular data partition ID or by using default for an established default partition. You can establish a default partition in the DataPartition data type.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the signal.

nested_params.name: maxSampleCount
nested_params.description: The maximum number of samples to collect.

nested_params.name: minimumSamplingIntervalMs
nested_params.description: The minimum duration of time (in milliseconds) between two triggering events to collect data.

nested_params.name: dataPartitionId
nested_params.description: The ID of the data partition this signal is associated with. The ID must match one of the IDs provided in dataPartitions. This is accomplished either by specifying a particular data partition ID or by using default for an established default partition. You can establish a default partition in the DataPartition data type.

parameters.name: collectionScheme
parameters.description: The data collection scheme associated with the campaign. You can specify a scheme that collects data based on time or an event. timeBasedCollectionScheme (dict) --- Information about a collection scheme that uses a time period to decide how often to collect data. The time period (in milliseconds) to decide how often to collect data. For example, if the time period is 60000, the Edge Agent software collects data once every minute. conditionBasedCollectionScheme (dict) --- Information about a collection scheme that uses a simple logical expression to recognize what data to collect. The logical expression used to recognize what data to collect. For example, $variable.`Vehicle.OutsideAirTemperature` >= 105.0. minimumTriggerIntervalMs (integer) --- The minimum duration of time between two triggering events to collect data, in milliseconds. triggerMode (string) --- Whether to collect data for all triggering events ( ALWAYS). Specify ( RISING_EDGE), or specify only when the condition first evaluates to false. For example, triggering on 'AirbagDeployed'; Users aren't interested on triggering when the airbag is already exploded; they only care about the change from not deployed => deployed. conditionLanguageVersion (integer) --- Specifies the version of the conditional expression language.

nested_params.name: timeBasedCollectionScheme
nested_params.description: Information about a collection scheme that uses a time period to decide how often to collect data.

nested_params.name: periodMs
nested_params.description: The time period (in milliseconds) to decide how often to collect data. For example, if the time period is 60000, the Edge Agent software collects data once every minute.

nested_params.name: conditionBasedCollectionScheme
nested_params.description: Information about a collection scheme that uses a simple logical expression to recognize what data to collect.

nested_params.name: expression
nested_params.description: The logical expression used to recognize what data to collect. For example, $variable.`Vehicle.OutsideAirTemperature` >= 105.0.

nested_params.name: minimumTriggerIntervalMs
nested_params.description: The minimum duration of time between two triggering events to collect data, in milliseconds.

nested_params.name: triggerMode
nested_params.description: Whether to collect data for all triggering events ( ALWAYS). Specify ( RISING_EDGE), or specify only when the condition first evaluates to false. For example, triggering on 'AirbagDeployed'; Users aren't interested on triggering when the airbag is already exploded; they only care about the change from not deployed => deployed.

nested_params.name: conditionLanguageVersion
nested_params.description: Specifies the version of the conditional expression language.

parameters.name: dataExtraDimensions
parameters.description: A list of vehicle attributes to associate with a campaign. Enrich the data with specified vehicle attributes. For example, add make and model to the campaign, and Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise will associate the data with those attributes as dimensions in Amazon Timestream. You can then query the data against make and model. Default: An empty array (string) ---

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Metadata that can be used to manage the campaign. (dict) --- A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the resource. The tag's key. The tag's value.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The tag's key.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The tag's value.

parameters.name: dataDestinationConfigs
parameters.description: The destination where the campaign sends data. You can send data to an MQTT topic, or store it in Amazon S3 or Amazon Timestream. MQTT is the publish/subscribe messaging protocol used by Amazon Web Services IoT to communicate with your devices. Amazon S3 optimizes the cost of data storage and provides additional mechanisms to use vehicle data, such as data lakes, centralized data storage, data processing pipelines, and analytics. Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise supports at-least-once file delivery to S3. Your vehicle data is stored on multiple Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise servers for redundancy and high availability. You can use Amazon Timestream to access and analyze time series data, and Timestream to query vehicle data so that you can identify trends and patterns. (dict) --- The destination where the campaign sends data. s3Config (dict) --- The Amazon S3 bucket where the Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise campaign sends data. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon S3 bucket. dataFormat (string) --- Specify the format that files are saved in the Amazon S3 bucket. You can save files in an Apache Parquet or JSON format. Parquet - Store data in a columnar storage file format. Parquet is optimal for fast data retrieval and can reduce costs. This option is selected by default. JSON - Store data in a standard text-based JSON file format. storageCompressionFormat (string) --- By default, stored data is compressed as a .gzip file. Compressed files have a reduced file size, which can optimize the cost of data storage. prefix (string) --- Enter an S3 bucket prefix. The prefix is the string of characters after the bucket name and before the object name. You can use the prefix to organize data stored in Amazon S3 buckets. For more information, see Organizing objects using prefixes in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide. By default, Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise sets the prefix processed-data/year=YY/month=MM/date=DD/hour=HH/ (in UTC) to data it delivers to Amazon S3. You can enter a prefix to append it to this default prefix. For example, if you enter the prefix vehicles, the prefix will be vehicles/processed-data/year=YY/month=MM/date=DD/hour=HH/. timestreamConfig (dict) --- The Amazon Timestream table where the campaign sends data. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Timestream table. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task execution role that grants Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise permission to deliver data to the Amazon Timestream table. mqttTopicConfig (dict) --- The MQTT topic to which the Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise campaign routes data. The ARN of the MQTT topic. The ARN of the role that grants Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise permission to access and act on messages sent to the MQTT topic.

nested_params.name: s3Config
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 bucket where the Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise campaign sends data.

nested_params.name: bucketArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_params.name: dataFormat
nested_params.description: Specify the format that files are saved in the Amazon S3 bucket. You can save files in an Apache Parquet or JSON format.

nested_params.name: storageCompressionFormat
nested_params.description: By default, stored data is compressed as a .gzip file. Compressed files have a reduced file size, which can optimize the cost of data storage.

nested_params.name: prefix
nested_params.description: Enter an S3 bucket prefix. The prefix is the string of characters after the bucket name and before the object name. You can use the prefix to organize data stored in Amazon S3 buckets. For more information, see Organizing objects using prefixes in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide. By default, Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise sets the prefix processed-data/year=YY/month=MM/date=DD/hour=HH/ (in UTC) to data it delivers to Amazon S3. You can enter a prefix to append it to this default prefix. For example, if you enter the prefix vehicles, the prefix will be vehicles/processed-data/year=YY/month=MM/date=DD/hour=HH/.

nested_params.name: timestreamConfig
nested_params.description: The Amazon Timestream table where the campaign sends data.

nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Timestream table.

nested_params.name: executionRoleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task execution role that grants Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise permission to deliver data to the Amazon Timestream table.

nested_params.name: mqttTopicConfig
nested_params.description: The MQTT topic to which the Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise campaign routes data.

nested_params.name: mqttTopicArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the MQTT topic.

nested_params.name: executionRoleArn
nested_params.description: The ARN of the role that grants Amazon Web Services IoT FleetWise permission to access and act on messages sent to the MQTT topic.

parameters.name: dataPartitions
parameters.description: The data partitions associated with the signals collected from the vehicle. (dict) --- The configuration for signal data storage and upload options. You can only specify these options when the campaign's spooling mode is TO_DISK. The ID of the data partition. The data partition ID must be unique within a campaign. You can establish a data partition as the default partition for a campaign by using default as the ID. The storage options for a data partition. The maximum storage size of the data stored in the data partition. The data type of the data to store. The maximum amount of time to store data. The folder name for the data partition under the campaign storage folder. The amount of time that data in this partition will be kept on disk. After the designated amount of time passes, the data can be removed, but it's not guaranteed to be removed. Before the time expires, data in this partition can still be deleted if the partition reaches its configured maximum size. Newer data will overwrite older data when the partition reaches the maximum size. The time increment type. The minimum amount of time to store the data. uploadOptions (dict) --- The upload options for the data partition. The logical expression used to recognize what data to collect. For example, $variable.`Vehicle.OutsideAirTemperature` >= 105.0. conditionLanguageVersion (integer) --- The version of the condition language. Defaults to the most recent condition language version.

nested_params.name: id
nested_params.description: The ID of the data partition. The data partition ID must be unique within a campaign. You can establish a data partition as the default partition for a campaign by using default as the ID.

nested_params.name: storageOptions
nested_params.description: The storage options for a data partition.

nested_params.name: maximumSize
nested_params.description: The maximum storage size of the data stored in the data partition.

nested_params.name: unit
nested_params.description: The data type of the data to store.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The maximum amount of time to store data.

nested_params.name: storageLocation
nested_params.description: The folder name for the data partition under the campaign storage folder.

nested_params.name: minimumTimeToLive
nested_params.description: The amount of time that data in this partition will be kept on disk.

nested_params.name: uploadOptions
nested_params.description: The upload options for the data partition.

nested_params.name: expression
nested_params.description: The logical expression used to recognize what data to collect. For example, $variable.`Vehicle.OutsideAirTemperature` >= 105.0.

nested_params.name: conditionLanguageVersion
nested_params.description: The version of the condition language. Defaults to the most recent condition language version.

parameters.name: signalsToFetch
parameters.description: A list of information about signals to fetch. (dict) --- Information about the signal to be fetched. The fully qualified name of the signal to be fetched. The configuration of the signal fetch operation. timeBased (dict) --- The configuration of a time-based signal fetch operation. The frequency with which the signal fetch will be executed. conditionBased (dict) --- The configuration of a condition-based signal fetch operation. The condition that must be satisfied to trigger a signal fetch. Indicates the mode in which the signal fetch is triggered. conditionLanguageVersion (integer) --- The version of the condition language used. The actions to be performed by the signal fetch. (string) ---

nested_params.name: fullyQualifiedName
nested_params.description: The fully qualified name of the signal to be fetched.

nested_params.name: signalFetchConfig
nested_params.description: The configuration of the signal fetch operation.

nested_params.name: timeBased
nested_params.description: The configuration of a time-based signal fetch operation.

nested_params.name: executionFrequencyMs
nested_params.description: The frequency with which the signal fetch will be executed.

nested_params.name: conditionBased
nested_params.description: The configuration of a condition-based signal fetch operation.

nested_params.name: conditionExpression
nested_params.description: The condition that must be satisfied to trigger a signal fetch.

nested_params.name: triggerMode
nested_params.description: Indicates the mode in which the signal fetch is triggered.

nested_params.name: conditionLanguageVersion
nested_params.description: The version of the condition language used.

nested_params.name: actions
nested_params.description: The actions to be performed by the signal fetch.

nested_items.description: The name of the created campaign.
